command.name: opentag
command.description:
Description: Manipulate file tags (both spotlight and openmeta) and rating.
Examples: show tags and ratings opentag -TR /path
show tags and ratings for multiple files opentag -TR /path/1 /path/2
show tags opentag -T /path
show opentag and spotlight tags opentag -sT /path
add tags opentag -a foo,bar /path
add opentag and spotlight tags (prefix with spotlight tags with '@') opentag -sa -p '@' foo,bar /path
add tags with spaces to all pdf files opentag -a "three word tag","foo bar" *.pdf
set tags to foo and bar for all files with "portfolio" in the name ls | grep -i portfolio | opentag -s foo,bar $
clear all tags opentag -c /path
clear tag foo opentag -u foo /path
set rating (0 - 5 stars) opentag -r 3 /path
show rating opentag -R /path
clear rating opentag -U /path

option.name: addTag
option.description: add tag(s) (use a comma to seperate multiple tags)

option.name: debug
option.description: enables debug mode, displays the options and arguments passed to the parser

option.name: prefix
option.description: spotlight comment tag prefix, defaults to '&'

option.name: spotlight
option.description: apply tagging commands to spotlight comments

option.name: setTag
option.description: set tag(s) (use a comma to seperate multiple tags)

option.name: untag
option.description: remove tag(s) (use a comma to seperate multiple tags)

option.name: variables
option.description: enables variable mode, displays the value of all program variables

argument.name: files
argument.description: file(s) to tag, enter '$' to read from standard input
